datafield.subfield: Historia Indiae Occidentalis, excerpts, translated by Gian Battista Sassetti di Teodoro, Summario della generale storia delle Indie occidentali; Peter Martyr's account of the New World, accounts of Magellan's voyage, and other works :
Unrestricted, for either reading room or classroom use.
Includes two printed illustrations and several drawings of flora.

MS 3327, Container 51: Sir Thomas Phillipps (1792-1872), Catalogus, no. 11721; acquired in 1973 by the Ransom Center (R5374) from Jenkins Company. Binding (England 19th c): Full red-brown tanned calfskin over paper boards. Straight caps; bookblock rounded and backed; hollow tube, smooth spine; edges cut before sewing. No cover decoration, blind tooling on spine, title gold-tooled on second panel. No endbands. Sewn on three flattened (?) cords laced on boards. Endleaf components: front tipped trimmed fold lightweight handmade laid paper making pastedown, free endleaf, plus sewn folds (three nested) undersized heavier deckle-edge off-white handmade laid paper making six additional free endleaves; back - two text blanks, plus tipped trimmed fold lightweight handmade laid paper making pastedown, free endleaf.
Medieval and Early Modern Manuscripts Collection.
